Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
Habitat
<networking, graphics> The original term for on-line graphical {virtual communities} or worlds. Created at Lucasfilm in 1985 by Randy Farmer and Chip Morningstar.
{(http://www.communities.com/habitat.html)}.
(1996-06-12)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Habitat \Hab"i*tat\ (h[a^]b"[i^]*t[a^]t), n. [L., it dwells, fr. habitare. See {Habit}, v. t.] 1. (Biol.) The natural abode, locality or region of an animal or plant. [1913 Webster]
2. Place where anything is commonly found. [1913 Webster]
This word has its habitat in Oxfordshire. --Earle. [1913 Webster]
habitat n : the type of environment in which an organism or group normally lives or occurs; "a marine habitat"; "he felt safe on his home grounds" [syn: {home ground}]
